text: Squadron Leader John Stewart Hart (11 September 1916 – 18 June 2019) was a Canadian pilot in the Royal Air Force (RAF) from 1938 to 1946. He flew Lysanders in the RAF Army Cooperation Command, Spitfires in the Battle of Britain, Hurricanes in Burma and Mustangs in Italy. ==Awards== Distinguished Flying Cross (London Gazette on 15 June 1945) ==Reference== Category: 1916 births Category: 2019 deaths Category: Canadian World War II pilots Category: Mount Allison University alumni Category: People from Sackville, New Brunswick Category: Recipients of the Distinguished Flying Cross (United Kingdom) Category: Royal Air Force officers Category: The Few
